This study applied a weighted sum of sub-indices [ 18, 57] technique for aggregation purposes. Therefore, exposure, sensitivity, and the adaptive capacity index were assumed as the linear sum of their indicators, and measured according to Equation (2):

where EI, SI, and ACI represent the values of the exposure index, sensitivity index and adaptive capacity index, respectively; W i represents the weight of the i th indicator (i = 1, 2, …, m); and Y i represents the normalized value of the i th indicator. A similar technique was applied for analyzing the index of the 12 (twelve) sub-components.
